definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: When I please my boss, I am ass-kissing.
sentences.chinese: 當我討上司歡心的時候，我是拍馬屁。

sentences.english: I hate to truckle to my superiors.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡對上司惟命是從。

sentences.english: Your boss is the point where your group attaches to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 你的頂頭上司就是你們組和大樹的聯結點。

sentences.english: Do you click well with your colleagues and boss?
sentences.chinese: 你和同事上司相處得融洽嗎？

sentences.english: Use cluelessness as an opportunity to gain more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 把上司的無知作爲獲得更多責任的機會。

sentences.english: And in that former life you had an affair with a superior officer's wife and they pushed you out.
sentences.chinese: 你以前曾與你的上司的妻子有緋聞，爲此你被開除了。

sentences.english: He told his boss the whole story exactly as it had happened.
sentences.chinese: 他把事情一五一十地都給他的上司講了。

sentences.english: Ms. Anderson climbed onto the boss's desk and did a striptease.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，安德森爬到上司的辦公桌上，跳起了脫衣舞。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I don't really hit it off with my bos .
sentences.chinese: 很不幸，我和我的上司不很處得來。

sentences.english: Being unappreciated by your boss could make it hard to do your work effectively.
sentences.chinese: 上司的不賞識會影響你的工作效率。

sentences.english: It’s going to take some time to get used to a boss like her.---by Sonya Roy
sentences.chinese: 要適應像她那樣的上司，還得要一段時間呢。

sentences.english: Maybe you have an irreconcilable personality difference with your manager.
sentences.chinese: 也許你同你的上司有不可調和的性格差異。

sentences.english: The boss finally bludgeoned him into accepting responsibility.
One of the best clues to company dress codes is what your boss wears.
sentences.chinese: 有一個好方法，就是跟隨你的上司的穿法。

sentences.english: Female boss is always eph gus friends.
sentences.chinese: 女上司始終是弗格斯的朋友。

definition: to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
